title: How to Make Vegan Smashed Potatoes

steps.headline: Put the potatoes in a saucepan and cover them with water.
Cover the pot and cook the potatoes over medium-high heat for 20 minutes, or until tender when speared with a fork.
Drain the potato water.
steps.description: Place a colander in the sink and pour the potato water into it. Alternatively, put the lid over the pan and carefully drain the water.

steps.headline: Transfer the potatoes to a deep bowl, or hand mash them in the same saucepan with a potato masher or large fork until they are somewhat lumpy.
steps.description: You can also use a potato ricer, which makes the potatoes fluffier.

steps.headline: Add the olive oil to the potatoes while they’re still warm and continue mashing.
Add small amounts of soy milk and/or reserved potato water until you reach the desired consistency of your dish.
steps.description: You want the potatoes to be slightly lumpy, but not too dry.

steps.headline: Season the potatoes with salt and pepper.

text: Put the potatoes in a saucepan and cover them with water.  Cover the pot and cook the potatoes over medium-high heat for 20 minutes, or until tender when speared with a fork.  Drain the potato water. Place a colander in the sink and pour the potato water into it. Alternatively, put the lid over the pan and carefully drain the water. Transfer the potatoes to a deep bowl, or hand mash them in the same saucepan with a potato masher or large fork until they are somewhat lumpy. You can also use a potato ricer, which makes the potatoes fluffier. Add the olive oil to the potatoes while they’re still warm and continue mashing.  Add small amounts of soy milk and/or reserved potato water until you reach the desired consistency of your dish. You want the potatoes to be slightly lumpy, but not too dry. Season the potatoes with salt and pepper.  Finished.
